page.title: 11RELIGION;A GENERAL SURVEY.
page.content: The denominations in our area are Methodist,United Reform,Roman Catholic,Anglican,and Society of Friends.Methodists and Anglicans.About 10% of the people in this area go to church or chapel every Sunday.The churches and chapels still being used are these:Talland church(Anglican), Riverside Church,West Looe(United Reform and Methodist),St.Nicholas at West Looe and Sclerder Abbey(Roman Catholic).The Society of Friends meet in private houses. {Sclerder Abbey.} This was founded in 1841 by the daughter of Sir Henry Trelawney who had been to Brittany-"Sclerder" is Breton for light.The nuns now belong to an order called the Poor Clares,which is an enclosed order.The Roman Catholic priest lives at Sclerder.{(cont. on P.12)
